name: toadflax
content:
Add to word list

one of several different wild plants with yellow, white, or purple flowers, some of which can cause problems in areas where they do not grow naturally: During summer the corn poppies, cornflowers, and toadflax hum with insects. Ivy-leaved toadflax, with its tiny blue and yellow flowers, grows on brick walls.
More examplesFewer examplesThe yellow toadflax has now spread across the eastern half of South Dakota. Yellow toadflax has a flower that looks a bit like a snapdragon.Dalmatian toadflax is another noxious weed we can do without.
